author: A_Brickset_user
review: Well guys, of course the older helicopters were better, but this is the type of thing that is being made now, and it is pretty good. Nice sleek design, and to end that hair color thing down at the bottom of the page, IT'S BROWN! Not too many of any kind of piece to be good for getting in bulk, but there are some good trans green pieces

author: A_Brickset_user
title: Good old Dash!
review: This set is an ultimate and automatic 10 because it holds Dash, my favorite minifig!!!! Dash is ofcourse wearing his Alpah team garb an his unique brown hair piece. He also drives the Alpha Team spycopter. It has the most dopey controls in the helicopter but you can just replace them like "snap"! The only slight problem is that Dash sometimes is too tall for the cockpit and his big hair keeps the canopy from shutting fully. The helicopter has some cool radar things and a "gun" connected by gears. The rotors are neon green advanced blades and use a differant, more loose swinging connector to spin more swiftly. This helicopter also has a rope with a hook, with the skinny helicopter landing gear. It also has a long stretcheria and a cool tail-end part with a jet piece and tail fins. This is awesome, such a differant helichopper. Get it!

author: A_Brickset_user
title: The controls for the chopper are wierd.
review:
They are! There is a computer, and a set of binoculars! The playability is EXCELLENT, it is mucho grande fun. Sorry about the spanish. Dash is a great mini-fig, I currently have 1 Mission: Deep Sea, 2 Regular Alpha Team, and 2 Arctic Alpha Team. ALpha team is great. Great Idea, excecuted excellent. Yea.


NOTE: This is technicly my brother's.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: coolness!
review:
This set has Dash, my favorite A Team minifig.
The helicopter wings really spin. The winch is cool, I can put a handle piece on top of something and pull it up and away with it. The copter also has gears with guns on the end.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: A nice little helicopter...
review:
It looks cool, has a cool agent (Dash is one of my favourite Alpha Team agents) and a hook you can do lots of great stuff with! The only thing it's missing is a propeller on the back. 
How is he supposed to stear the helicopter without that?
In my opinion, this is one of the coolest Alpha Team sets i bought.

author: deluckybrick
title: Awesome helicopter
review:
I dont usually buy Alpha Team, and I own no other, but this set has it all.  Cool colors, nice action, good pieces, and Dash.  Dash, Dash, Dash.  He is the centerpiece of all of my escapades.  I love his uniform.  Also, I love the skis on the helicopter.

9/10

author: smiley905
title: cool helicopter
review: this is a realy good helicopter, it looks good, and matches the other alpha team sets. the cocpit is a realy good peices and the tail is designed well. dash is pretty cool, and you can take off one of the guns on the side for him to have. the pipes along the side are cool, and this is a great set. the one thing rong with it is thst the main proppeler is to small. but other than that everythings cool.

author: Tri_pod_king
title: My favorite Alpha Team set
review:
I don't know where to start. I just loved this set!(If only I could say the same about the Agents sets) I remember me wanting this set so bad, then going to Target to buy it. I remember the anticipation and excitement. Building it was a real treat. My mom helped me because I was only 5 years old when I got it.
         Anyway, on to the review:
                                 *PROS*
                          (Detailed Dash minifig. One of the best ones ever.(along with the one in 4745 Blue 
                        Eagle vs. Snow Crawler)
                          (Great design
                          (Very sturdy
                          (Rope in the back works well
                          (Great playability and displayability
                          (Pretty transparent pieces

                                 *CONS*
                                (It's not available any more. If it was, I'd buy it again to relive the greatness.

                                     This is Tri-pod king signing out of a review of one the best Lego sets EVER!

author: jjr
title: my first alpha team set!
review:
when I was a kid I, my grandparents always bought together with me something. mostly lego's. afcourse not to expensive sets ;) When I saw this new theme I really wanted this one. now on to the pros and cons.

pros

it's really cheap for a good lego set
you get the leader of alpha team, dash
cool color scheme
good playability (however it could have included a small ogel vehicle)
not to many stickers
comic!! I really loved those at that age

cons

cheap, not in money but in parts. many over juniorized pieces
really easy build
looks kinda small, but I don't know the price anymore so that has not to be a con

overal

a really cool AT vehicle, it's cool but comparerd to todays sets it's kinda small. still if you want to buy some alpha team sets you have to get this one!

author: KLOKRIECHER
title: LEGO Alpha Team - Alpha Team Helicopter
review:
The Alpha Team Helicopter (6773) is a LEGO Alpha Team set which came out in 2001. It comes with 1 minifig and 79 pieces. This set does include a few decals and there're no mistakes in the instructions and no missing pieces.

[img]http://www.klokriecher.de/gallery_pics/l/6773-1.jpg[/img]


Minifigures:

Dash: Dash comes with a black suit with some cool markings on it and a brown hair piece. You can see a grin on his face and there's also a beard and a headset on it. The legs of agent Dash are printed.


Alpha Team Helicopter:

The alpha team helicopter is very easy to build. The windscreen opens easily and there's a cool computer in the inside with a binoculars on the top of the screen. The minifigs fits on his place very easily. On the one side you can see a radar and on the other side is a machine gun. Both parts do sviwel. On the black and yellow tube you can see some guns as well and on the back you can see the engines. The blades to spin full 360Â° and can be moved up and down.

Ideas:

This set also comes with 2 ideas which you can build with the pieces of this set. There're no instructions for those models but you can build them from the pictures on my website.


Positive:

Great pieces which you can youse for brickfilms or MOC's
Minifig
Ideas which you can build with the pieces of this set
Nice starter set


Negative:

This set has a few stickers
Not so many play features.


All in all it's a great set to get and I would highly recommend you to get this model. You can find this set on eBay, BrickLink and Amazon for sure. Here is the link where you can check out the full galery I made for this set on my website: http://www.klokriecher.de/

Videos I made of this set:

Stopmotion 1
Stopmotion 2
Stopmotion 3
Review

author: Legonat
title: another one of the best alpha team sets
review:
• I must say I was satisfied with this.

  •        Pros
                Dash (his last name is Justice),
                The helicopter blades spin pretty good,
                A lowering hook,
                A weapon and a recorder (on the sides of the helicopter),
                Rare translucent pieces,
                Rare windshield piece,
                Inside the helicopter is a tracking device and binoculars

                Cons:
                Usually a helicopter has a propeller on the other end too,
                The propeller blades hang down when you try to spin them,
                The hook does not have a crank to reel it back up,
                It probably wouldn't hurt to add some Ogel thing,
                It doesn't Have a colored piece signifying what agent it belongs to
     

           overall a 5/5

author: NickBrick
title: The names Dash. James Dash
review: This was one of my first Lego sets. And my favorite Alpha team set. The Alpha team helicopter is a nicely designed set. It's sturdy, it has a good color scheme, And it comes the best Alpha team agent of all time. Dash! It has 2 laser machine guns up front, a sonic gun located on the side, and a electric gun on the side. Inside the cockpit we find Dash sitting at a printed control panel. Along with some super binoclars. And in the back you will notice a fine rope and pulley system. Perfect for taking Ogle out of the picture. The only annoying thing in the set is that time works against it. The rotor blades can't work anymore because they are so loose. But if you can find a nice sturdy version of this copter it will a wonderful edition indeed. Oh and I know his name is not James Dash! Its Dash Justice.

author: Odeinoichus
title: Dash Soars through the Skies in his Helicopter
review:
Set #6773 Alpha Team Helicopter: The second cheapest set, the Alpha Team Helicopter introduces us all to the leader of Alpha Team, Dash, and his vehicle of choice for the first year's mission against Ogel. Is of course a Helicopter.

 

Surprisingly enough this set was really quite fun, with it's black and transparent green pieces the Helicopter stands out when put next to the Helicopters more commonly found in LEGO City sets. There are a few stickers for the Alpha Team Logo details on the rear fins of the helicopter and the cockpit, which I think was a slightly darker tinted piece compared to other uses of the same piece.

 

Dash as far as Mini-Figures go is a fun looking Mini-Figure. His face is printed with a more serious look to it compared to the friendlier citizens of LEGO Town/City, it also includes a mouthpiece for radio communications. This was my first exposure to this particular piece of hair as well, the straighter looking brown hair piece that was introduced by LEGO at this time. His torso printing is the Alpha Team uniform, which went down to his legs I think. Not sure if it was the type of plastic used or where his torso originated from, but he cracked on both sides of the torso, which was a real shame because it made his legs looser and prone to detaching when he was seated in the helicopter and you wanted to take him out.

 

Overall though this set is a great piece from LEGO Alpha Team, there were notably a few pieces that enjoyed falling off while playing with it, such as the landing gear and the tail, but if you were careful while handling it you could avoid this. Also, it looked a little bit better without the landing gear while in flight. So there was no real loss when the part did happen to fall off. I'd recommend it to any Alpha Team fans. Or anybody looking for some Helicopters for their LEGO City Airport that aren't Police or Fire oriented.
